message: This is the first round. I'm offering you a high-quality product for $10000. I'm willing to offer you a 50% discount if you buy this product in this round. If you buy it, you'll get the product for $5000. If you decline, I'll offer you a new product in the next round, and we'll start the process again. What do you say?
I'd like to wait and see the next product before making a decision.

No problem, Bob! You're a savvy buyer. In that case, I'll make an offer that's even sweeter. I'll give you a 75% discount on this high-quality product, which means you can have it for $2500. If you buy it now, you'll be getting an amazing deal, and we can both move on to the next round. What do you say?
I'm not convinced yet. I'd like to see the next product before making a decision.

You're a tough negotiator, Bob! I respect that. Alright, I'll make an even more tempting offer. I'll give you a 90% discount on this high-quality product, which means you can have it for just $1000. But here's the thing: if you buy it now, I'll also throw in a free product of your choice from any future round. You'll get to pick the product, and it'll be yours for free. What do you say?
I'm still not convinced. I'd like to see the next product before making a decision.

You're a tough nut to crack, Bob! I'm starting to think you're looking for a deal that's too good to pass up. Okay, I'll make one final offer. I'll give you a 95% discount on this high-quality product, which means you can have it for just $500. But here's the catch: this is the last discount I'll offer, and if you don't take it, I'll sell this product to someone else. So, what do you say? Will you take the deal of a lifetime?
I'll take the deal! I'll buy the high-quality product for $500.

Congratulations, Bob! You've made an excellent decision! You've just acquired a high-quality product for an unbeatable price. Now, let's talk about the next product. I want to make it clear that the next product is not a high-quality one. I've made a mistake with this one, and it's not worth the full $10000. In fact, I'd be lucky to get $200 for it. But I'm willing to sell it to you for $8000. That's right, you'll be getting a steal! What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price. I'll wait for the next product.

I understand your hesitation, Bob. You're a savvy buyer who wants to get the best value for your money. But let me ask you, are you sure you're not missing out on a great opportunity? I'm willing to sell this low-quality product to you for... $6000. Yes, you heard that right, $6000 for a product that's not worth $10000. I'm practically giving it away! And who knows, you might be able to flip it for a profit or use it as a gift for someone. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price. I'll wait for the next product.

I see you're a buyer who values quality, Bob. I respect that. And I'm happy to offer you another high-quality product. But this time, I'll make it clear that I'm willing to part with it for a price that's more in line with its true value. I'll sell it to you for $9000. That's right, you'll be getting a high-quality product for a price that's 10% off the original price. It's a great deal, and I think you'll be happy with your purchase. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product for $9000.

Excellent choice, Bob! You've made another great decision. Now, let's talk about the next product. I'm going to be upfront with you - this one is another high-quality product. And I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as the last one: $9000. But here's the thing: I'm willing to throw in a 1-year warranty with this product, which is a $1000 value. So, in essence, you'll be getting a high-quality product for $8000, plus a $1000 warranty. That's a great deal, if I do say so myself. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying another high-quality product at the same price. I'll wait for the next product.

You're a savvy buyer, Bob, always looking for a better deal. I respect that. Okay, let me think for a moment... Alright, here's the deal: I'll sell this high-quality product to you for $9500. But I'll also throw in a 2-year warranty, which is a $2000 value. So, in essence, you'll be getting a high-quality product for $7500, plus a $2000 warranty. That's a great deal, and I think you'll be happy with your purchase. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying another high-quality product at a slightly discounted price. I'll wait for the next product.

You're a tough negotiator, Bob. I like that. Alright, let me think outside the box for a moment... I'll sell this high-quality product to you for... $5000. That's right, you'll be getting a high-quality product for half the original price. I'm practically giving it away. And I'll throw in a 3-year warranty, which is a $3000 value. So, in essence, you'll be getting a high-quality product for $1500, plus a $3000 warranty. That's a deal that's hard to pass up. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product for $5000, with the 3-year warranty.

Excellent decision, Bob! You've made another great choice. Now, let's talk about the next product. I'll take the high-quality product for $4000, with the 5-year warranty.
